      • TotalSupportTree

        public TotalSupportTree(myDataset ds,
                        double sup,
                        double conf)
        Constructor to process dataset and parameters.
        Parameters:
        ds - The instance of the dataset for dealing with its records
        sup - The user-specified minimum support for the mined association rules
        conf - The user-specified minimum confidence for the mined association rules

    • Method Detail

      • addToTtree

        public void addToTtree(short[] itemSet,
                       int support)
        Commences process of adding an itemset (with its support value) to a T-tree when using a T-tree either as a storage mechanism, or when adding to an existing T-tree.
        Parameters:
        itemSet - The given itemset. Listed in numeric order (not reverse numeric order!).
        support - The support value associated with the given itemset.

      • addToTtree

        protected TtreeNode[] addToTtree(TtreeNode[] linkRef,
                                 int size,
                                 int endIndex,
                                 short[] itemSet,
                                 int support)
        Inserts a node into a T-tree.

        Recursive procedure.

        Parameters:
        linkRef - the reference to the current array in Ttree.
        size - the size of the current array in T-tree.
        endIndex - the index of the last element/attribute in the itemset, which is also used as a level counter.
        itemSet - the given itemset.
        support - the support value associated with the given itemset.
        Returns:
        the reference to the revised sub-branch of t-tree.

      • getSupportForItemSetInTtree

        protected int getSupportForItemSetInTtree(short[] itemSet)
        Commences process for finding the support value for the given item set in the T-tree (which is know to exist in the T-tree).

        Used when generating Association Rules (ARs). Note that itemsets are stored in reverse order in the T-tree therefore the given itemset must be processed in reverse.

        Parameters:
        itemSet - the given itemset.
        Returns:
        returns the support value (0 if not found).

      • generateARs

        public void generateARs()
        Initiates process of generating Association Rules (ARs) from a T-tree.

      • generateARs2

        protected void generateARs2()
        Loops through top level of T-tree as part of the AR generation process.

      • generateARs

        protected void generateARs(short[] itemSetSofar,
                           int size,
                           TtreeNode[] linkRef)
        Continues process of generating association rules from a T-tree by recursively looping through T-tree level by level.
        Parameters:
        itemSetSofar - the label for a T-tree node as generated sofar.
        size - the length/size of the current array lavel in the T-tree.
        linkRef - the reference to the current array level in the T-tree.

      • setNumOneItemSets

        public void setNumOneItemSets()
        Sets the number of one item sets field (numOneItemSets to the number of supported one item sets.

      • outputFrequentSets

        public void outputFrequentSets()
        Commences the process of outputting the frequent sets contained in the T-tree.

      • countNumFreqSets

        protected int countNumFreqSets()
        Commences process of counting the number of frequent (large/supported sets contained in the T-tree.
        Returns:
        number of frequent sets counted

      • countNumFreqSets

        protected int countNumFreqSets(int size,
                               TtreeNode[] linkRef,
                               int num)
        Counts the number of supported nodes in a sub branch of the T-tree.
        Parameters:
        size - the length/size of the current array level in the T-tree.
        linkRef - the reference to the current array level in the T-tree.
        num - the number of frequent sets sofar.
        Returns:
        the counted number of supported nodes in a sub branch

      • getNumFreqSets

        public int getNumFreqSets()
        Commences the process of counting and returning number of supported nodes in the T-tree.

        A supported set is assumed to be a non null node in the T-tree.

        Returns:
        the number of supported nodes in the T-tree.

      • getCoveredRecords

        protected java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> getCoveredRecords(short[] itemset)

      • getCoveredRecords

        public java.util.HashSet<java.lang.Integer> getCoveredRecords()
        Retrieves all the records which are covered by the association rules
        Returns:
        a set of TIDs representing the covered records.
